content.title: CONSULTANCY AGREEMENT
key_sections: 1. SERVICES: [DESCRIPTION]. Consultant provides services with reasonable skill and care.
2. STATUS: Consultant is self-employed independent contractor, not employee. Responsible for own tax and NI. IR35: [INSIDE/OUTSIDE - must determine].
3. FEES: [£RATE per day/hour] or [£FIXED_FEE]. Expenses: [reimbursed if pre-approved / not reimbursed]. Payment [DAYS] days from invoice.
5. TIME: [DAYS/HOURS per week/month]. Flexible working arrangements. Consultant controls how/when work performed (IR35 consideration).
6. SUBSTITUTION: Consultant [may/may not] provide substitute (IR35 factor).
7. EQUIPMENT: Consultant provides own equipment and tools (IR35 factor).
8. IR35 DETERMINATION: [If inside IR35: Client will operate PAYE. If outside: Consultant invoices as self-employed. SDS (Status Determination Statement) attached.]
9. IP: [Pre-existing IP retained. Work product: [CLIENT/CONSULTANT] owns. Assignment of rights upon payment.]
10. CONFIDENTIALITY: Mutual obligations during and after agreement.
11. NON-SOLICITATION: [If appropriate: Consultant will not solicit Client's employees/clients for [PERIOD].]
12. LIABILITY: Limited to [fees paid / insurance limit]. No limit for fraud or death/injury.
13. TERMINATION: [NOTICE] notice or immediate for breach/insolvency.
content.ir35_checklist:
IR35 factors (outside IR35 requires):
✓ Substitution right (genuine)
✓ Control (consultant controls when/how work done)
✓ Mutuality of obligation (no obligation to offer/accept work beyond current engagement)
✓ Equipment provided by consultant
✓ Financial risk (fixed fee, not daily rate like employee)
✓ Part and parcel (not integrated into organization)
✓ Intention (commercial relationship, not disguised employment)

If inside IR35 (employment-like), client must deduct tax/NI.

compliance_checklist: IR35 status determined (SDS if medium/large client)
Control, substitution, equipment provisions support status
